thread.title: UNWTO Secretary General and Seychelles Tourism Minister arrive in Kenya for Africa forum
thread.title_full: UNWTO Secretary General and Seychelles Tourism Minister arrive in Kenya for Africa forum

author: eTN Editor
title: UNWTO Secretary General and Seychelles Tourism Minister arrive in Kenya for Africa forum
text:
UNWTO Secretary General and Seychelles Tourism Minister arrive in Kenya for Africa forum   
Aug 21, 2015 eTN   
Taleb Rifai, the Secretary General of the UNWTO (United Nations World Tourism Organization), and Minister Alain St.Ange, the Seychelles Minister responsible for Tourism and Culture, were greeted on their arrival in Nairobi by Kenya's PS for Tourism and the MD of the Kenya Tourism Board. 
This meeting that is aimed at exploring more togetherness in the East African countries as well as more cooperation with the Indian Ocean Vanilla Islands comes at a time when Kenya's tourism industry is back up and running, and travel advisories that were imposed for security reasons have been removed. 
Both Secretary General Taleb Rifai and Minister Alain St.Ange sat with Mr. Muriithi Ndegwa, the Managing Director of the Kenya Tourism Board, as they signed the Official Visitors Book at the airport (see photo). 
This UNWTO meeting is expecting to rally tourism ministers and heads of tourism authorities from the East Africa region and from the Indian Ocean Vanilla Islands together to look at regional tourism. 
Seychelles is a founding member of the International Coalition of Tourism Partners (ICTP) . Source: Seychelles Ministry of Tourism and Culture
